definitions.definition: In a way or manner that is real, not unreal.

definitions.example: "He really is a true friend." / "Really? What makes you so sure?"

definitions.definition: (as an intensifier) Very (modifying an adjective); very much (modifying a verb).
definitions.example: But ma, I really, really want to go to the show!

definitions.definition: Indicating surprise at, or requesting confirmation of, some new information; to express skepticism.
definitions.example: A: He won the Nobel Prize yesterday.

definitions.definition: (sarcastic, typically exaggerated question.) Indicating that what was just said was obvious and unnecessary; contrived incredulity
definitions.example: A: I've just been reading Shakespeare - he's one of the best authors like, ever!
A: That girl talks about herself way too much.

definitions.definition: Indicating displeasure at another person's behaviour or statement.
To ally anew; to re-form an alliance.
